title: 114_hr1504
content:
The Act titled "Reducing Federal Mandates on School Lunch Act" prohibits regulations that establish certain limits for the school lunch program. The Act "Reducing Federal Mandates on School Lunch Act" prohibits the implementation of certain regulations related to calorie limits and food quantities in the school lunch program until a law extending program authorizations by at least 5 fiscal years is enacted. The Act establishes a maximum calorie limit or quantity of grains, meat, or meat alternatives for the school lunch program under the Richard B. Russell School Lunch Act. SEC. 3. Establishes sodium target levels and whole grain requirement for the school lunch program under the Richard B. Russell School Lunch Act. Section 9(f) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to include sodium target levels and whole grain requirements for federally reimbursed meals in schools. The Secretary is prohibited from implementing regulations that would reduce sodium levels below Target 1 or change the whole grain requirement. The Secretary shall require half of all grains in federally reimbursed meals to be whole grain-rich, and school food authorities must comply with the applicable grain component or standard in effect before July 1, 2014. SEC. 4. PROHIBITION OF OTHER NUTRITION REGULATIONS FOR CERTAIN SCHOOL FOOD AUTHORITIES. Prohibition on implementing nutrition regulations for school food authorities until the authorization of certain programs is extended. The school food authority may face increased costs due to compliance with operational procedures and regulations. The Secretary of Agriculture is prohibited from defining or suggesting how costs should be calculated. The regulations include nutrition standards for the National School Lunch Program and School Breakfast Program. The Department of Agriculture published nutrition standards for all foods sold in schools under the Healthy, Hunger-Free Kids Act of 2010. This includes regulations related to school lunch price increases. The Department of Agriculture published regulations under the Healthy, Hunger-Free Kids Act of 2010, including increasing school lunch prices. Part 220 of title 7, Code of Federal Regulations, establishes new meal patterns and nutrition standards for the school breakfast program. SEC. 5. RULES OF CONSTRUCTION.

The Secretary of Agriculture is not prohibited from implementing, administering, or enforcing rules or regulations not described in this Act, including parts 210 and 220 of title 7, Code of Federal Regulations.
